title: Top 3 of CFP unchanged; Tide drop, UGA to No. 4
content: Ohio State, Indiana and Texas A&M remained the top three teams in the latest College Football Playoff rankings released Tuesday, while Alabama dropped six spots to No. 10 and was replaced by Georgia at No. 4.

title: LeBron kicks off record 23rd year with Lakers win
content: Lakers star LeBron James made his season debut against the Jazz on Tuesday night, taking the court to begin a league-record 23rd season.

title: Chase's 1-game suspension for spitting upheld
content: Ja'Marr Chase's one-game suspension for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey was upheld Tuesday, meaning the star Bengals receiver will not play Sunday against the Patriots.

title: After big win, Poch objects to 'regular' player talk
content: Mauricio Pochettino dismissed the idea of the United States having "regular players" after an alternate starting lineup thrashed Uruguay 5-1 on Tuesday in Tampa.

title: Pope rues 'poorly coached' Kentucky after blowout
content: Kentucky coach Mark Pope took responsibility for the Wildcats' struggles Tuesday night, saying his team is "completely discombobulated" after an 83-66 loss to Michigan State.

title: Deion: Need more time, but Buffs have 'right man'
content: Deion Sanders, who will post his second losing season in three years in Colorado, insisted he is "the right man" to lead the Buffaloes but said he needs more time.

title: Kerr worried NBA's upped pace leading to injuries
content: Steve Kerr said he's "very concerned" that the NBA's increased pace of play combined with a condensed schedule is leading to an increase in soft tissue injuries.

title: Woo's debut 2026 mock draft: Where Peterson, Dybantsa, Boozer could land
content: Early injuries scattering the No. 1 pick race? Only two guards in the top 10? Let's project all 30 picks for the 2026 first round.

title: Week 12 NFL Power Rankings: Bengals and Vikings drop, plus who is under the most pressure on each team
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 12. Plus, who is under the most pressure for each team over the rest of the 2025 season?

title: Player ratings: Freeman's brace gets 9/10 as USMNT stuns Uruguay
content: Two goals from Alex Freeman added cream to a superlative performance from the USMNT, thrashing Uruguay 5-1 to close out 2025.

title: 'Cool and new thing for me': Zdeno Chara on entrepreneurship, his new job with the Bruins and more
content: Since retiring from the NHL, Chara hasn't slowed down at all. We caught up with the former Bruins captain, who opened up about his life and goals outside of the rink.

title: The compassionate toughness of 'Last Chance U' coach John Beam
content: The coach, who died Friday after being shot in his office, was a champion for Oakland and his players.

title: Men's Bracketology: Arizona sees big boost, plus a new No. 1 overall seed
content: The Wildcats are stacking Quad 1 wins while teams on the top line shuffle in latest NCAA tournament projections.

title: Women's Bracketology: How one bad week cost the ACC
content: Last week, ACC teams made up a quarter of the top 16. Now, just UNC and NC State remain as projected hosts.

title: Is the salary cap a problem? Are teams still breaking rules?

title: 'I wouldn't be here without him:' Why Daniel Jones is leaning on a longtime Peyton Manning confidant
content: Jones leaned on David Cutcliffe during his struggles with the Giants and even after losing to Pittsburgh this season.

title: 'He's already unlocked things': Why the Magic needed Desmond Bane
content: Orlando is hoping its all-in approach for Desmond Bane will help stars Paolo Banchero and Franz Wagner win a championship.

title: Fixing the Mavs: Why there's no cure-all for this Dallas disaster
content: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

title: Navy's uniforms for 2025 Army-Navy game pay homage to USS Constitution
content: The uniform draws inspiration from the ship, which was one of the six original frigates of the U.S. Navy and is the world's oldest commissioned warship still afloat.

title: Individual rankings for each position in Week 12
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Cam Skattebo, Abdul Carter and Giants scuffle ringside with Judgement Day at 'Raw'
content: The New York Giants took matters into their own hands -- or fists -- when Judgement Day called them out.

title: 'The canaries in the coal mine': Why teams like Man United invest in player care
content: Helping players excel on the field isn't just about fitness and nutrition; it also involves taking care of their needs and stress away from the game.

title: Premier League stars through 11 games
content: Who have been the standouts of the season's first few months? Ian Darke goes team-by-team to break it down.

title: 2026 World Cup: Curaçao make history, Panama and Haiti qualify
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it's looking around the globe.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot since 1998
content: With the likes of Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard, Norway are ready to make an impact on the big stage.

title: Boxing's top 25 under 25: Itauma, Norman, Mason, Fundora, more
content: Boxing's future is in a great place with many young fighters making their mark in the sport. Here's our list.

title: How five-star Austin Goosby fits at Texas, more 2026 commitment projections
content: Breaking down top class of 2026 commitments, including the five-star who stayed in-state to play for Texas.

title: Kerala district administrations seek volunteers for SIR of electoral rolls amid pressure on BLOs
content: House-to-house enumeration phase of SIR has been mired in controversy with BLOs, political parties and service organisations complaining that BLOs are overburdened with work on account of operational overlap with upcoming local body elections and pressure to meet unfair deadlines

title: Stalker stabs schoolgirl to death in Rameswaram
content: On Wednesday morning, while the girl was on her way to school, the accused confronted her near Sethupathi Nagar and stabbed her in the neck, the police said

title: Al Falah Group chaiman Jawed Siddiqui in ED custody for 13 days in money laundering case
content: The ED has alleged that the Al Falah University falsely claimed that it is a UGC recognised university and misrepresented its NAAC status

title: 3-year-old killed, another child injured after school bus runs over students in Kerala’s Idukki
content: After a bus dropped students off in front of the school, they walked towards the back of the vehicle to enter the classroom. Soon, another school bus entered the spot which hit the children and ran over them

title: 'Tally is now 60': Congress after Trump repeats India-Pakistan peace broker claim
content: "I've stopped actually eight wars. Have another one to go with, (Russian President Vladimir) Putin, the U.S. President said in his bilateral meeting with the Saudi Crown Prince

title: Digital arrest fraud: Elderly man from Kerala loses ₹1.51 crore from his bank account
content: Probe underway to track the source of the bank account used to receive the defrauded money by the fraudsters who pretended as enforcement officers

title: YSRCP leaders accuse A.P. govt. of neglecting Hindu Dharma, temples
content: The YSRCP also took objection to the reported insult to Rani Sadasivamurthy, Vice-Chancellor of Sri Venkateswara Veda Vignana Peetham, removing him on what he termed unjust and baseless grounds

title: De-addiction centre in every district to help check drug abuse, says A.P. Minister
content: Pointing out that EAGLE stands for Elite Anti-Narcotics Group for Law Enforcement, the Minister said it brings together various departments such as Police, Excise and Education

title: Seven more Maoists killed in exchange of fire in Maredumilli forests of Andhra Pradesh
content: Top Maoist leader Metturi Joga Rao alias Tech Shankar among those slain, said police; firing is continuing as per latest report

title: New models for inclusive travel and design unveiled at Open Sky, Open Mind Summit and Awards 2025 in Bengaluru
content: OSOM 2025 showcased how airports, technology, and universal design can work together to build an ecosystem where every person, regardless of disability, can navigate the world with dignity and independence

title: Kerala local body polls: How printing industry is reaping big gains as candidates woo voters
content: Trend of posters featuring candidates in cinematic frames seems to have brought in good money for the printing industry. Unlike the past, candidates now prefer printing materials in multiple designs and sizes, offering a business bonanza for creators

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: IUML scrambling to preserve its stronghold in Kottakkal
content: Though it won 21 of the 32 seats the previous election, internal disputes resulted in a party rebel becoming the chairperson, albeit for a brief period, with LDF support

title: Kerala local body polls: RSP at an existential crossroads
content: The previous two elections saw the party virtually eliminated from representation in Assembly. In the 2015 local body elections and the subsequent Assembly polls, the LDF made deep inroads into traditional RSP territory

title: Kerala local body polls: Migration redrawing political map of central Travancore
content: Across multiple local bodies in three central Travancore districts, political parties concede that voter numbers have either stagnated or declined over the past five years. For parties whose social base lies deeply embedded in the regions religious and community networks, this demographic shift has become an existential challenge

title: Two Sri Lanka-bound flights diverted to Thiruvananthapuram airport due to bad weather
content: The Dammam-Colombo flight and the Turkish Airlines flight will depart for their destinations once weather improves in Sri Lanka, say airport officials

title: Allahabad HC sets aside conviction of Mohammad Ilyas in 1996 bus bomb blast case
content: A two-judge Bench comprising Justice Siddharth and Justice Ram Manohar Narayan Mishra vacated the conviction, observing that the prosecution "miserably failed" in proving the charges

title: T.N. CM Stalin accuses Centre of denying Metro Rail projects for Coimbatore, Madurai on flimsy grounds
content: Mr. Stalin said pushing such a political custom, in which BJP-ruled States get Metros for smaller Tier II cities while opposition-ruled States are deprived, is a disgraceful approach

title: What can local bodies expect from the 16th Finance Commission? | Explained
content: What do the 73rd and 74th constitutional amendments mandate? What have multiple State Finance Commission reports recommended? How have Union Finance Commissions failed to bring about substantial changes, especially with respect to performance-linked grants?

title: A lost garden and a forgotten square in Chennai
content: Walking down Badrian’s Garden, which is seeped in history, is something of an adventure today, putting life and limbs at risk

title: The row over Karunanidhi’s ‘Anna way-Periyar way’ remark during 1991 election campaign
content: Although Karunanidhi was quick to clarify his observation made during poll campaign in Coimbatore district on May 15 in 1991, it did not satisfy many.

title: AIADMK cadres realise that SIR is a danger, says DMK MP N.R. Elango
content: He said the AIADMK had supported the SIR without understanding the problems, doing so merely to please the BJP.

title: Toddler run over near Vaniyambadi
content: Unaware of the baby on the carriageway, the driver took the vehicle and the baby was crushed under the wheels.

title: LED lights won’t affect ornaments of Arunachaleswara Temple deities during procession: HR&CE
content: It comes in the wake of a section of devotees and residents in the temple town fearing that LED lighting, which goes for hours, on the idols during procession could have an adverse effect on their ornaments.

title: 90% of adults in Tamil Nadu say they have personally felt the effects of global warming: Yale Climate Opinion maps
content: Tamil Nadu, one of India’s most urbanised and industrialised States, has been facing rising temperatures, erratic rainfall, and frequent extreme weather events.

title: When a policeman casually took a powerful bomb inside police station in Chennai
content: The incident involving ‘tiffin box bomb’ in Tamil Nadu in 1998 is worth recalling in light of the accidental blast of seized explosives at the Nowgam police station in Jammu and Kashmir on November 14, 2025, which led to death of nine persons.

title: Yamuna Boat Tourism Project will offer a green tourism experience with electric-solar boats
content: The project located upstream of the Wazirabad Barrage between Sonia Vihar and Jagatpur, seeks to offer a new green tourism experience

title: Gujarat police partners with indigenous app MapmyIndia for real-time traffic alerts, road safety
content: Gujarat police partners with indigenous app MapmyIndia for real-time traffic alerts, boost road safety

title: Congress contesting polls independently will only help BJP, says Mouthpiece of Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: In the party mouthpiece Saamana, Shiv Sena (UBT) warned Congress that the move only helps BJP and would cause a rift in the opposition alliance Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA)

title: Bombay High Court sets aside interest payment order against Boney Kapoor in MPID case
content: Bombay High Court relieves Boney Kapoor of interest liability after MPID court acquits key accused in ₹57.7 crore deposit fraud case.

title: BJP’s defeat in Anta bypoll foments dissent with questions over campaign strategy
content: Seven-time BJP MLA and a veteran leader of the Hadoti region in south-eastern Rajasthan, Pratap Singh Singhvi, has blamed former Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje and the party leadership for the loss

title: Sena Ministers skip Cabinet meet; BJP dismisses talks of discord over ‘poaching’
content: Fadnavis tells Sena Ministers that parties in Mahayuti should stop inducting each other’s leaders; Shinde expresses similar views; Ravindra Chavan brings more Sena members into BJP fold

title: Sonbhadra stone quarry collapse: Death toll at seven as search and rescue ops conclude
content: Three accused yet to be arrested; each deceased worker's family will receive around ₹20 lakh from government

title: Nearly 90% of adults in Maharashtra say they have personally experienced global warming
content: New Climate Opinion Maps reveal how experience and beliefs about climate change vary across India. Erratic monsoons, floods, and droughts are reshaping lives across Maharashtra, fueling public concern but mixed beliefs about human causation.

title: Chhattisgarh ATS apprehends two minors for links with ‘Pakistan-based ISIS module’
content: Police said that the handlers attempted to disseminate ISIS ideology and violent provocative content and set up an ISIS module in Chhattisgarh through the duo

title: Transfer rumors, news: City eye move for Cologne's El Mala
content: Manchester City are reportedly looking to sign FC Cologne winger Said El Mala. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Follow the public and add Scott Wedgewood, Justin Faulk and these trending players
content: Fantasy hockey goalie notes, power play trends, and a look at the most added and dropped players this month.

title: More than 75% traffic challans unpaid in tri-commissionerates, Hyderabad tops with ₹187 cr.  dues
content: Hyderabad, Cyberabad and Rachakonda collectively logged in 1.29 crore traffic challans in 2025, yet over 99 lakh remain unpaid as the tri-commissionerates are battling an unprecedented compliance crisis

title: Biryani sellers-turned-bike lifters arrested in Bengaluru
content: The Mahadevapura police have arrested two persons who worked as biryani vendors during the day and allegedly turned into serial offenders at night, stealing high-end motorcycles parked outside houses

title: Techie murdered for asking back loan, body buried inside house in Andhra Pradesh
content: A 30-year-old software engineer who went missing from Attibele was found murdered and buried inside the house of his cousin in Andhra Pradesh

title: Residents of mental health care facilities can vote unless declared as disqualified: HC
content: Individuals with mental health issues and those with intellectual disabilities too are citizens of the country, says court; dismisses plea that such persons are incompetent to cast their votes as per their free will

title: Congress’ bid to field BJP leader in Cheralayi division falls flat
content: Shyamala S. Prabhu declines to contest as an Independent backed by the UDF in Cheralayi; says she remains loyal to the BJP; Congress announces Meenu Rajan, an ASHA worker, as its candidate in the division

title: Anbumani opposes proposed SIPCOT complex in Cuddalore
content: He says the district is already facing environmental degradation due to industrial pollution from the coal mines in the area

title: Third TN Rising Conclave set to draw new investments into Coimbatore on November 25
content: The conclave will be the 3rd regional investment summit in T.N. after Thoothukudi and Hosur, deliberately shifting the spotlight away from Chennai and reinforcing our commitment to distributed growth, says Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa

title: Indonesian Minister’s Delhi visit to advance BrahMos defence partnership
content: The Indonesia deal will be a major milestone for India’s defence exports, showcasing the country’s capability to supply advanced, combat-proven indigenous weapons, officials said

title: 130 Sri Lankan refugees in Tamil Nadu rehabilitation camps eligible to apply for Indian passports: official survey
content: The survey was undertaken a few months ago by the State  Commissionerate of Rehabilitation and Welfare of Non-Resident Tamils among the residents of the camp. It covered only sections of the camp residents and its findings should not be considered exhaustive

title: Brain fever: Karnataka issues health advisory to Sabarimala pilgrims
content: People have been advised to visit the nearest hospital if they experience symptoms such as fever, headache, nausea, neck stiffness or behavioural disorders

title: Karnataka police launch ‘Sanmitra’ initiative to combat drug abuse
content: In a major step towards curbing the growing menace of drug addiction among the youth, the Karnataka State Police Department has rolled out ‘Sanmitra’ ( a good friend ), an initiative aimed at providing sustained support, rehabilitation, and monitoring for individuals struggling with substance abuse

title: A village with a temple and real estate boom on East Coast Road
content: A lot of devotees visit the Nithyakalyanaperumal Temple at Thiruvidanthai daily. But they are inconvenienced by lack of amenities. Chennai residents buy up land here, attracted by clean air

title: Two arrested for teenager’s murder
content: A search has been launched for at least four others, including the person who allegedly stabbed the deceased using a sharp iron rod

title: Russia to soon approve nearly 25 Indian fishery units for exports
content: Recently, the European Union (EU) has approved 102 additional marine product units from India for exports

title: India, Russia intensify consultations ahead of Putin’s Delhi visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi meets head of Russia’s Maritime Board, External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar meets with President Putin in Moscow

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat to visit strife-torn Manipur
content: Visit comes amid talks for popular government formation; RSS chief had earlier called for peace in the State

title: ‘India needs to catch up with China’s breakneck speed in innovation’
content: Experts expressed the view that product-led growth should be the focus rather than one that relies on being the ‘back office of the world’ with millions of engineers who write codes

title: SIR work preventing completion of syllabus for half-yearly exam, say school teachers
content: Over 68,000 teachers, anganwadi workers, noon meal works, and electricity bill readers, among others in Tamil Nadu have been deputed as Booth Level Officers

title: Conclave on migration ends; stressed need to address social aspects of migration
content: International Institute of Migration and Development chair S. Irudaya Rajan says there has been a rise in suicide cases of Indians in countries like Canada, where at least one migrant attempts suicide every week

title: KEONICS receives pre-orders for 1,500 units of its new AI-computer
content: KEO is Karnataka’s practical answer to the digital divide, says Priyank Kharge about the computer priced at ₹18,999

title: 2020 Delhi riot was not spontaneous but pre-planned, Solicitor General tells Supreme Court
content: Tushar Mehta says the Delhi riot was nothing less than an “attack on the sovereignty of the nation” and the version of spontaneity being peddled is a “myth”

title: Kerala B.Tech students develop ‘EVM Track’ software for State Election Commission
content: Aashin C. Anil and Jeswin Sunsi were felicitated by State Election Commissioner A. Shajahan for their contribution to the electoral process

title: Separate Section created in DPDP Rules for persons with disabilities
content: In the draft rule regarding consent mechanism, persons with disabilities had been clubbed with children; activists hail separation of Sections in the notified rules, but raise concern over lack of clarity on laws of guardianship

title: Think Bengaluru traffic is bad? Try controlling it
content: The Hindu reporter gets an opportunity to man one of Bengaluru’s busiest traffic junctions during the morning peak hour.

title: Coffee Board of India sets a target to double production to over 7 lakh tonnes by 2047
content: Goal is to achieve 15% speciality coffee out of this 7 lakh tons, says Coffee Board Chairman M.J. Dinesh

title: Over 100 minors, held as bonded labourers, rescued from Raipur factory
content: NHRC member says that the children – mostly tribals from Assam, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Odisha – were exposed to formaldehyde, a chemical known to cause cancer

title: NEP in Maharashtra: Panchet’s model cluster school highlights gains—and gaps
content: Maharashtra’s school mergers seek to enhance resources and accessibility, but face criticism over their impact on education equity.

title: Jaishankar calls on Russian President Putin
content: “Apprised him (Mr. Putin) of preparations underway for the upcoming Annual India Russia Summit. Also discussed regional and global developments. Deeply value his perspectives and guidance on further advancement of our ties,” Mr. Jaishankar said

title: On Bangladesh’s extradition request for Hasina, Delhi has several options
content: No formal extradition request received yet; treaty permits exceptions for “political offences”, “unjust or oppressive charges”; Delhi could allow Ms. Hasina her say during an extradition trial or deny ICT’s validity

title: Raj Bhavan files police complaint against Trinamool MP for arms distributed from Governor House remark
content: The complaint by Raj Bhawan commission of offence under Section 151 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Samhita (BNS) which is non bailable in nature. Governor Bose had indicated that he will take strongest possible action against the  Trinamool MP for the remark that arms were distributed from Raj Bhawan.

title: Watch: Rohini Acharya slams journalist for saying 'married daughters' remark; video viral
content: Rohini Acharya, daughter of Lalu Prasad, strongly criticized a journalist's remark that married daughters shouldn't spend much time at their parents' home. She also condemned accusations of profiting from her kidney donation to her father, urging critics to donate themselves instead.

title: Andhra Pradesh: PM Modi offers prayers at Sri Sathya Sai Baba’s Mahasamadhi — video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Puttaparthi to honor spiritual leader Sri Sathya Sai Baba's birth centenary, paying respects at his Mahasamadhi. Accompanied by Andhra Pradesh leaders, the PM also released commemorative stamps and a coin celebrating Baba's legacy. Later, he will inaugurate a natural farming summit in Coimbatore and release PM-KISAN funds for farmers.

title: Thaw in ties? Musk at Trump's dinner with Saudi prince; video shows prez giving him brief tap
content: Elon Musk's appearance at a White House dinner with President Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman suggests a potential thawing of their recent feud. This comes after Musk publicly criticized Trump and hinted at his involvement in the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, a stark contrast to his earlier support.

title: AI godfather Yann LeCun: ChatGPT tech is wrong ; leaving Meta to prove it
content: Meta's chief AI scientist Yann LeCun, a Turing Award winner and one of the godfathers of AI, says large language models powering ChatGPT and similar chatbots are fundamentally flawed and will never achieve human-level intelligence. He's leaving Meta to launch a startup focused on "world models," which learn through visual data like humans do. LeCun argues current AI systems are less intelligent than cats and warns the industry's $100+ billion LLM investment is misguided, marking a dramatic split from his employer's strategy.

title: 2nd Test: Uncertainty over Gill; Reddy rejoins team as Sudharsan, Padikkal step up in nets
content: Shubman Gill's potential absence due to a neck injury poses a significant challenge for India's second Test against South Africa. Sai Sudharsan and Devdutt Padikkal are prime contenders to replace him, though the team faces a dilemma with their left-handed batting. Nitish Kumar Reddy's recall also fuels speculation about team changes.

title: ‘Attempt to flaunt patriotism’: Ricin terror-plot accused attacked in jail; assaulted by 3 inmates
content: A terror accused, Syed Ahmed Mohiuddin Abdul Qader Jilani, was assaulted by three inmates in Sabarmati Central Jail shortly after his transfer. One attacker reportedly cited patriotism as the motive for the assault, which was quickly intervened by other prisoners. The incident has prompted an investigation into jail security and potential collusion.

title: TikTok twist: How China’s app saved Meta from huge fine
content: A US federal judge dismissed the FTC's antitrust lawsuit against Meta, ruling that the company's acquisitions of Instagram and WhatsApp did not illegally monopolize the social media market. The judge found that Meta faces significant competition from platforms like TikTok and YouTube, rendering its market dominance obsolete. This decision marks a major victory for Meta after a lengthy legal battle.

title: IND vs SA: 'Coach thodi jaake khel raha hai' - Ex-India cricketer backs Gambhir amid criticism
content: The Eden Gardens pitch for the India-South Africa Test sparked debate after India's batting collapse. Coach Gautam Gambhir defended the surface, stating it was as requested and playable. Robin Uthappa supported Gambhir, emphasizing the coach doesn't play the game and highlighting a double standard in pitch scrutiny between domestic and international cricket.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where is gold headed in coming days? Check rate outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may trade sideways in the coming days. The broader upward trend for gold remains intact. Silver is expected to remain volatile. Investors are watching for cues on US interest rate cuts.

title: India-US trade deal: No hiatus in ties; Goyal hints at ‘good news’ soon
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal indicated that a trade pact between India and the US is nearing completion, emphasizing the need for a fair, equitable, and balanced agreement. He assured that India will continue to protect the interests of its farmers, fishermen, and small industries during ongoing negotiations.

title: Tech company turmoil: Founder who topped Elon Musk loses 30% value - what happened?
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.

title: 6 warning signs of kidney damage from taking too much vitamin D
content: Excessive Vitamin D supplementation can lead to hypercalcemia, straining the kidneys and causing nephrocalcinosis, potentially resulting in acute kidney injury or failure. Early symptoms like nausea, thirst, and frequent urination signal critical electrolyte imbalances. Careful use under medical supervision and regular monitoring are crucial to prevent overdose and protect kidney health.

title: India's Eden debacle: Underprepared pitch, shoddy technique, lack of specialists - IND vs SA
content: India's debacle at the Eden Gardens against the reigning World Test Champions (WTC) in the first Test has raised a plethora of questions -- the team's preparation after playing a white-ball series in Australia, India batters’ dodgy technique against quality spin and the lack of specialists in the Test squad.

title: CBSE Board Exams: Class 10, 12 subject-wise marks distribution released; check details
content: The CBSE has released the subject-wise distribution of marks for Class 10 and 12 board exams in 2026. Practical, project, and internal assessments will be conducted from January 1 to February 14, 2026. Schools are cautioned against mark-upload errors and advised to strictly follow the provided guidelines for a smooth examination process.

title: Candace Owens sparks chaos with new Britney trafficking claim as Lou Taylor trends
content: Britney Spears shared a heartwarming Instagram video with Kim and Khloé Kardashian, sparking viral attention. Simultaneously, Candace Owens leveled serious accusations on her podcast, alleging Lou Taylor's manipulative control over Britney and other stars, citing an insider email and historical patterns of financial and media exploitation. Owens' claims, though unproven, have ignited significant discussion.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Cardinals coach assesses recovery amid slump
content: Arizona Cardinals running back Trey Benson, who replaced an injured James Conner, is sidelined with a brutal knee injury sustained in Week 5. Despite initial hopes for a Week 10 return, his recovery timeline remains unclear. Head coach Jonathan Gannon stated Benson is progressing but not yet ready to play, marking his sixth missed game.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Historic! Population 1.56 lakh - Curacao becomes smallest nation to qualify for FIFA World Cup
content: Curacao has achieved a historic feat, becoming the smallest nation to ever qualify for the FIFA World Cup. Their draw against Jamaica secured their spot in the 2026 finals in the United States, Canada and Mexico. This remarkable achievement marks a significant moment for the Caribbean island. Elsewhere, Haiti also secured a World Cup berth after a long absence.

title: Paris alleges Michael's estate executors 'pocketed' USD 10 mn for personal gain
content: Paris Jackson has intensified her legal battle against her late father's estate, asserting that the executors have overstepped their authority and mismanaged finances. She alleges that more than $10 million was wrongfully appropriated in 2021, significantly overshadowing distributions to beneficiaries. Paris is concerned that the estate is being exploited for selfish interests instead of honoring Michael Jackson's legacy.

title: ‘Quiet, Piggy’: Journalist asks Trump about Epstein files; US President snaps
content: Donald Trump escalated his confrontations with women journalists, calling a Bloomberg reporter "piggy" and a "terrible reporter" to an ABC News correspondent. He accused ABC of "fake news" and urged regulators to "look at" revoking its license. The incidents renewed criticism of his treatment of female reporters.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ seen as revisiting Joe Alwyn breakup, not Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Taylor Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Didn’t want to return as ‘homosexuality not accepted’: HIV+ Syrian man held for overstaying
content: A Syrian national was apprehended in Gujarat for overstaying his visa by two years, reportedly to remain with his same-sex partner in Khambhalia. Both individuals are HIV positive.

title: Fully functional: Solid gold toilet fetches $12.1m at NYC auction; artwork was titled ‘America’
content: A solid gold toilet, Maurizio Cattelan's satirical artwork 'America,' fetched $12.1 million at Sotheby's New York. This 18-karat, fully functional sculpture, weighing over 220 pounds, previously gained fame at the Guggenheim and was famously offered to President Trump. The piece, a commentary on wealth, has a history including a dramatic heist where another edition was stolen and likely melted down.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 84,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was below 25,900, BSE Sensex was near 84,600.

title: 'Smashed his head with hammer': Missing Bengaluru techie killed over money deal; buried 125km away
content: A software engineer, missing since October 27, was found buried in a house in Kuppam, Andhra Pradesh. Police arrested his cousin, Prabhakar, and an associate for the murder. Prabhakar confessed to killing the victim over a Rs 40 lakh business investment that went sour.

title: Rollercoaster! From century relief to ICC reprimand & a duck: Babar Azam hits new low
content: Just days after ending an 807-day century drought, Pakistan's Babar Azam faces renewed scrutiny. He was fined by the ICC for a conduct breach and then dismissed for a duck against Zimbabwe, marking his third duck in six T20Is. This follows a period of intense criticism, with former PCB chairman Ramiz Raja urging patience and focus on performance.

title: Delhi postpones admissions for children of EWS category: New date awaited
content: Delhi's Directorate of Education has postponed the final computerised draw for EWS/DG admissions in private schools for the 2025-26 academic session due to administrative reasons. The draw, initially set for November 19, 2025, has been deferred, with a new date yet to be announced. Parents and schools are advised to monitor the official website for updates on the revised schedule.

title: 'Used by Hamas': Israel strikes Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon; 13 killed
content: Israel launched an airstrike on Lebanon's Ain el-Hilweh refugee camp, killing at least 13 people. The military stated the target was a Hamas training compound used for planning attacks. This strike occurs nearly a year after a ceasefire with Hezbollah ended intense cross-border fighting, marking one of the deadliest Israeli actions in Lebanon since then.

title: Ronaldo at White House dinner: Trump hosts Saudi Crown Prince; football icon praised during gala
content: Football icon Cristiano Ronaldo attended a White House dinner honouring Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, where President Trump highlighted Ronaldo's presence and his son's admiration. Ronaldo, a prominent figure in Saudi Arabia's Pro League, was acknowledged by Trump. The visit coincides with Saudi Arabia's upcoming 2034 World Cup hosting, a bid Ronaldo publicly supported.

title: Ind vs SA: South Africa’s Kolkata Test hero suffers injury; doubts rise ahead of Guwahati Test
content: South Africa is on the verge of a historic Test series win in India following their 30-run victory in the opening match. However, preparations for the second Test have been disrupted by injury concerns for key players Simon Harmer and Marco Jansen. This win propelled South Africa to second in the ICC World Test Championship standings.

title: TB or Lung Cancer? Know the symptoms and differences
content: India faces a dual challenge with widespread tuberculosis and rising lung cancer, often presenting with similar symptoms like chronic cough and weight loss. This diagnostic overlap, exacerbated by resource constraints and a tendency to suspect TB first, leads to delayed cancer detection.

title: 'Don't believe in God Hanuman': Complaint against Rajamouli for hurting religious sentiments
content: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli is facing a police complaint from the Vanara Sena organization for allegedly hurting Hindu sentiments with his remarks about Lord Hanuman. The comments were reportedly made during a promotional event for his upcoming film 'Varanasi' in Hyderabad. The police have received the complaint and are currently investigating the matter.

title: Hidma neutralised: Maoist commander killed; crackdown nears Shah's 2026 goal
content: The neutralization of Madvi Hidma, a key CPI (Maoist) leader, brings security forces closer to Home Minister Amit Shah's goal of ending left-wing extremism by March 2026. Hidma's death is considered a historic milestone, with remaining active cadres estimated between 100-150.  Intelligence suggests Hidma may have been considering surrender before his operation.

title: Suffering from chronic fatigue and brain fog? Leading neurologist explains
content: Dr. Sudhir Kumar says the ferritin test is important, when it comes to gauging overall health. Ferritin is a protein that stores iron in the body and ferritin levels in the blood, show how much iron is stored. Normal serum iron tests only measure iron that is moving in the blood, and the tests do not show if iron stores are low

title: IND vs SA: Decoding the drill - Why Sudharsan & Jurel batted with one pad
content: Indian batters Sai Sudharsan and Dhruv Jurel practiced with one pad to improve footwork against spin, an old drill forcing bat usage over pad defense. This comes as Sudharsan is in contention for the second Test against South Africa, who lead the series 1-0 after a first-Test victory.

title: Bryce Dunlap cause of death: Young fan’s life ends abruptly, raising questions
content: Bryce Dunlap, a 21-year-old Cleveland Browns fan, died from an anoxic brain injury following a sudden respiratory and cardiac emergency. His family honored his wish to donate organs, leading to a successful liver transplant for former Browns quarterback Bernie Kosar. The community has rallied in support, exceeding fundraising goals for his memorial.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for November 19- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari of Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommends Life Insurance Corporation of India, Coromandel, and Doms Industries for investment. Technical analysis indicates strong support levels and bullish crossovers for LIC and Coromandel, while Doms Industries shows a breakout and momentum revival.

title: ‘Defence boost, nuclear push’: US, Saudi Arabia ink major agreements; F-35 sale gets nod
content: The United States has finalized significant agreements with Saudi Arabia, including civil nuclear cooperation and AI partnerships. A major defense package, featuring F-35 jets and tanks, was also approved, bolstering regional security and US jobs. These pacts deepen the strategic alliance, with Saudi Arabia increasing its US investment commitments to nearly $1 trillion.

title: Bihar: BJP, JDU resist Chirag's demand for Dy CM post for his party; negotiations stretch on
content: NDA allies BJP and JDU are resisting LJP(RV)'s demand for a deputy chief minister post in the new Bihar government. Discussions are ongoing as the BJP may retain the Speaker's position, while LJP(RV) seeks representation for its Dalit vote base. The new government's composition reflects shifting power dynamics after the recent election victory.

title: SC: Justice Bhuyan criticises ruling; CJI Gavai refuses to give rejoinder
content: Justice Ujjal Bhuyan dissented with CJI B R Gavai's recall of a prior judgment, arguing the majority overlooked environmental jurisprudence fundamentals. Justice Bhuyan defended the original verdict, emphasizing the precautionary principle over the 'polluter pays' principle. CJI Gavai noted his departure from tradition by not altering his judgment after receiving the dissent.

title: How one glass of this drink daily, can boost arterial health and lower blood pressure
content: Boost your heart health with a simple cacao and beetroot drink, recommended by Dr. Eric Berg. This natural concoction enhances nitric oxide production, crucial for relaxing blood vessels and improving circulation.  It helps regulate blood pressure, reduces arterial stiffness, and combats inflammation, offering a powerful, daily defense against cardiovascular risks.

title: First meeting: Ex-VP Dhankhar calls on successor Radhakrishnan; no official details released
content: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar met his successor C P Radhakrishnan in a courtesy meeting, marking their first formal interaction since Dhankhar's resignation. Dhankhar had stepped down citing health reasons and is currently residing in a private accommodation while awaiting his retirement residence.

title: Coimbatore : PM Modi to release Rs 18k cr; PM-KISAN boost for 9 crore farmers
content: Prime Minister Modi embarks on a significant visit to Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu today. He will pay respects at Puttaparthi, marking Bhagwan Sri Sathya Sai Baba's centenary, and later inaugurate the South India Natural Farming Summit in Coimbatore. Crucially, he will release the 21st installment of Rs 18,000 crore under the PM-KISAN scheme, benefiting nine crore farmers.

title: Farhan Akhtar: ZNMD scene revived childhood bond with Javed Akhtar
content: Farhan Akhtar and Naseeruddin Shah may have shared only a single scene in Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara, but the moment remains one of the film’s most emotionally charged. Now, Farhan has opened up about filming the pivotal father–son confrontation, describing how the experience unexpectedly echoed his own childhood and his relationship with Javed Akhtar after his parents’ separation.

title: "Terrorism, Nothing Else": A Owaisi Trashes Bomber's 'Suicide Bombing' Talk
content: Suicide is haram (forbidden) in Islam, and the killing of innocents is a "grave sin", Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said in his response to the viral video of Delhi bomber Umar un-Nabi equating suicide bombing with "martyrdom".

title: Mumbai Couple Duped Out Of Rs 27 Lakh Over UK Job, Visa. 1 Arrested
content: A woman has been arrested in Mumbai after she and a man allegedly cheated a couple of Rs 27 lakh under the pretext of helping them with a job in London and visas to the United Kingdom, police have said.

title: Congress Pays Tribute To Indira Gandhi On Her Birth Anniversary
content: The Congress on Wednesday paid rich tributes to former prime minister Indira Gandhi on her birth anniversary, with Rahul Gandhi saying that he was inspired to make fearless decisions for India from his grandmother.

title: "Don't Harass Indian Sikh Woman Who Married Muslim Near Lahore": Pakistan Court
content: A high court in Pakistan on Tuesday ordered the police to stop harassing an Indian Sikh woman, who converted to Islam and married a local Muslim man whom she had met on social media.

title: Anti-Terrorism Squad Arrests 2 Chhattisgarh Teens For ISIS Links
content: The Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Chhattisgarh detained two boys in Raipur for their alleged links with terror outfit Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS), Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Sharma has said.

title: Fraud, Forgery, And More: How Al Falah University Duped Students Of Crores
content: Widespread irregularities have emerged at the Faridabad-based Al Falah Charitable Trust and its affiliated institutions that have been under the scanner amid a probe into the November 10 Delhi blast.

title: Google Launches Gemini 3: How Elon Musk And Sam Altman Reacted
content: Gemini 3 combines all previous Gemini capabilities, offering maximum-level reasoning and multimodal understanding, according to Sundar Pichai.

title: Allahabad High Court Set Aside Conviction Of 1996 Ghaziabad Bus Blast Accused
content: The Allahabad High Court has set aside the conviction of Mohammad Ilyas in the 1996 Modinagar-Ghaziabad bus bomb blast case on the ground that the prosecution failed to prove charges against the appellant.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Carbon Walls, Digital Borders, Trade Blocs: India's Exports Need A New Playbook
content: If India chooses innovation over inertia, collaboration over silos, and sustainability over shortcuts, it can turn this turbulent moment in global trade into an unprecedented opportunity.

title: "Quiet, Piggy" To "Terrible Reporter": Trump Hits Out At Women Journalists
content: Donald Trump ripped into a reporter from the US network ABC News on Tuesday, just days after calling another woman journalist "piggy" after she asked a question related to the convicted sexual offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Team Nitish's Oath Tomorrow, JDU-BJP Balance Caste Math In Minister Picks
content: Twenty-two ministers are expected to take the oath of office along with Chief Minister Nitish Kumar tomorrow during the grand swearing-in ceremony of the new NDA government in Bihar, according to top sources in the ruling coalition.

title: 8-Month Pregnant Indian Woman, Out On Walk, Killed In BMW Crash In Australia
content: According to her LinkedIn, Dhareshwar was a qualified IT systems analyst and was working as a test analyst for Alsco uniforms.

title: Trump Designates Saudi Arabia Major Non-NATO Ally During Crown Prince's Visit
content: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday he was designating Saudi Arabia as a major non-NATO ally, as he hosted Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for a gala dinner at the White House.

title: Deals And Bromance: Takeaways From Trump's Meeting With Saudi Crown Prince
content: US President Donald Trump greeted Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed at the White House's South Lawn entrance with a handshake and arm slung over the prince's shoulder.

title: 9/11 Survivors Furious Over Saudi Crown Prince's US Visit. How He Responded
content: Osama bin Laden used Saudi people for the 9/11 attacks to destroy US-Saudi relations, insisted Mohammed bin Salman at the White House, as the families of the victims pressed for accountability from the visiting Saudi Crown Prince.

title: Ajit Pawar's Son Parth Not Named In Rs 300-Crore Pune Land Deal Report
content: A Joint Inspector General of Registration headed committee, in its report into a controversial Rs 300-crore land deal of a Pune firm co-owned by Ajit Pawar's son Parth, has indicted the three persons named in the related police FIR, an official said.

title: "Apologise, Compensate": Dead Journalist's Wife Asks Saudi Prince To Meet Her
content: The widow of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was murdered by Saudi agents in 2018, has demanded an apology from Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for her husband's killing after he called it a "huge mistake".

title: SpaceX Cuts Starlink Service To Over 2,500 Devices At Myanmar Scam Centres
content: SpaceX has cut service to more than 2,500 Starlink internet devices at Myanmar scam centres, a company executive said on October 22, after AFP revealed that their use had exploded in the illicit industry.

title: AI Startup Anthropic Secures $15 Billion Investment From Microsoft, Nvidia
content: Nvidia and Microsoft announced Tuesday investments totaling $15 billion in AI startup Anthropic, creator of the Claude chatbot, amid frenzied spending on the technology and growing fears of a bubble.

title: Cloudflare Outage That Impacted ChatGPT, X, Dropbox Users Resolved
content: Cloudflare, based in San Francisco, works behind the scenes to make the internet faster and safer, but when problems flare up "it results in massive digital gridlock" for internet users, cybersecurity expert Mike Chapple said.

title: Paul vs. Joshua: Everything you need to know
content: he will face former heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua in a heavyweight fight Dec. 19 at Kaseya Center in Miami (Netflix) it's a drastic shift in gears after Paul was originally scheduled to face a catchweight of 195 pounds last week . the fight was canceled in the wake of a lawsuit filed by his ex-girlfriend that accused him of battery, aggravated battery, false imprisonment, kidnapping and intentional infliction of emotional distress .

title: Let's talk about North Texas -- why the Mean Green is the bet to make in December
content: north Texas is sitting -115 both ways to make or miss the playoff . the committee is reacting to resumes, but not quality wins . UNT has one loss, a 63-36 defensive collapse to south Florida .

title: Offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move

content: tuesday's vs. byu Cougars looks at our expanded top 20 through week 12 . toney reclassified into the 2025 class and wasted no time proving he was undervalued as a three-star recruit . he has also shown up against the toughest opponents .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5’s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: 🍼 Baker and wife Emily expecting baby No. 2
content: the couple have a daughter, Kova Jade, and will add a boy to the family . the couple broke the news with a gender reveal photoshoot as the two sliced a cake with blue coloring, indicating a baby boy .

title: O's acquire Ward from Angels for RHP Rodriguez
content: the Baltimore Orioles acquired outfielder Taylor Ward from the los Angeles Angels in exchange for right-hander Grayson Rodriguez . the 26-year-old was drafted no. 11 overall out of high school in 2018 . he posted a 4.11 ERA with 259 strikeouts against 78 walks in 23823 innings .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, if the big Ten likes it or not . a week-long playoff showdown between usC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .

title: What we learned from Duke's win over Kansas at Champions Classic
content: the 15th edition of Champions Classic ended with wins for the Kentucky Wildcats and Duke Blue Devils . the Spartans ran away with a 17-point victory, and the no. 5 blue Devils sealed the 12-point win . ESPN's college basketball reporter Myron Medcalf and NBA draft analyst Jeremy Woo break down what they're taking away from a star-studded night in new york .

title: Solak: Let's rank the best coaching hires and find the good in the Seahawks' loss

title: Who are the favorites for Tucker? Which teams will go all-in this winter? Passan's MLB offseason preview
content: the largest free agent contract the Pirates have ever handed out was more than a decade ago . the Pittsburgh Pirates were primed to spend more than twice that on Josh Naylor before he re-upped with Seattle for five years and $92.5 million in the first signing .
